tab.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: a set position in a line of writing that you get to by pressing the tab key
tab.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: an amount of money that you owe, or a record of an amount of money that you owe
tab.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: The tab for the campaign was nearly $500 million.
I’ll put it on your tab and you can pay tomorrow.
He ran up a $4,000 tab in long-distance calls.
tab.translation[0].definitions[3].defini: a small piece of metal that you pull to open a can of drink
tab.translation[0].definitions[4].defini: a small piece of metal, plastic, or paper that you pull to open something
tab.translation[0].definitions[5].defini: a small piece of paper, cloth, plastic etc that sticks out from the edge of something, so that you can find it more easily
tab.translation[0].definitions[6].defini: a small piece of sticky plastic with a date on it that you put on your car’s license plate in the US to show that the car is legally allowed on the road
tab.translation[0].definitions[7].defini: a form of the illegal drug LSD or ecstasy
tab.translation[0].definitions[9].defini: one of a number of web pages you have open at the same time
tab.translation[0].definitions[9].exampl: Do you want to close all tabs or the current tab?
tab.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: to press the tab key on a computer or typewriter
tab.translation[2].definitions[0].defini: a small piece of paper or cloth that is fixed to the edge of something, usually giving information about it
tab.translation[2].definitions[1].defini: a bill for something, especially one that has gradually increased over time
tab.translation[2].definitions[1].exampl: One out of three credit card holders pays their credit card tab in full every month.
the estimated government tab for resolving the S&L crisis
tab.translation[2].definitions[2].defini: a system used in some bars and restaurants in which they keep a record of what you have bought and you pay for it later
tab.translation[2].definitions[2].exampl: Can you put these drinks on my tab?
tab.translation[2].definitions[3].defini: to pay for something, especially when it is not your responsibility to pay
tab.translation[2].definitions[3].exampl: Taxpayers are picking up the tab for the government’s mistakes.
tab.translation[2].definitions[4].defini: a button on a computer keyboard that you press to move forward to a particular place on a line of text
